Texto: 
not available
chemotherapy with some decrease in the enhancing portion of tumor over past 6 months.
• enhancing lesions in the hypothalamus and chiasm.
• elevated signal intensity basal ganglia bilaterally, likely due to myelinopathic changes.
neurofibromatosis type 1 with hypothalmic and chiasmatic glioma
• meningioma
• craniopharyngioma
• pituitary adenoma
• neurofibromatosis hamartoma
• neurofibromatosis neoplasm (astrocytoma)
8 year old boy with a known diagnosis presents with decreasing visual acutity.
this child was known to have neurofibromatosis type 1 (nf1 or von recklinghausen disease).
